name: ONAP Gizmo
description: CRUD Rest API endpoint for resources and relationships, delivering atomic interactions with the graph for improved scalability.
contribution_justification: The process could be found in the following URL: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies
contribution_requirements_justification: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies describes requirements for acceptable contributions and is linked from the AAI project page. https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Java+code+style shows java code style. https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Developer+Best+Practices
license_location_justification:
Licence can be found in:
https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=aai/gizmo.git;a=blob;f=License.txt;h=328acac0de747df41031afcb0ab5370c5390ab45;hb=HEAD
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI). The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI) The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
repo_public_justification: Gizmo's version controlled repository can be found in https://gerrit.onap.org/r/#/admin/projects/aai/gizmo
repo_interim_justification: Tracking is provided by using a combination of JIRA and git history. Every commit has an user and a Jira number attached to it. Git history for Gizmo's master branch:https://gerrit.onap.org/r/gitweb?p=aai%2Fgizmo.git;a=shortlog;h=HEAD Jira for ONAP: https://jira.onap.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa
repo_distributed_justification: Gerrit provides an temperate branch for reviewing and providing comments. Once approved, the code will be merged and the temperate branch will be removed.
version_unique_justification: Release version is with format ${major}.${minor}.${patch} and will be updated accordingly for each release.
release_notes_justification: Release note can be found in http://onap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/submodules/aai/aai-common.git/docs/release-notes.html
report_tracker_justification: Jira is used to track issues. https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA
report_process_justification: The description of the process could be found in the following URL: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Tracking+Issues+with+JIRA
report_archive_justification: The report of issues are listed here: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Issue+Reports
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: Process on how to report a vulnerability can be found in https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/ONAP+Vulnerability+Management
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: Private vulnerability reports are not supported.
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: There's no vulnerabilities reported so far.
build_justification: Jenkins is used to build the artifact. https://jenkins.onap.org/job/aai-gizmo-master-release-java-daily/
build_common_tools_justification: Maven is used to build the project
test_justification: The project uses junit to run the unit tests.
test_invocation_justification: Tests can be run, by running the command "mvn clean install"
tests_documented_added_justification: This is documented on our wiki: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Code+Coverage+and+Static+Code+Analysis
warnings_fixed_justification: The application logs the relevant warnings.
warnings_strict_justification: Build systems run the compile with test flag enabled by default. So any failure in test cases will fail the ci and the merge request.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: Moving to Spring Boot to resolve vulnerabilities, but still, some policy alerts from Nexus IQ, which we are trying to resolve by upgrading the current libraries or exclude them.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: We are working on the current critical policies alerts from Nexus IQ
static_analysis_justification: SonarQube is run https://sonar.onap.org/dashboard?id=org.onap.aai.gizmo%3Agizmo.  Fortify is run.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: Moving to Spring Boot to resolve vulnerabilities, but still, some policy alerts from Nexus IQ, which we are trying to resolve by upgrading the current libraries or exclude them.
static_analysis_often_justification: This is part of Continuous Integration on a daily basis.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: For each pull request, the project needs to be built successfully before the Merge option becomes activated. The test will be run automatically during the building process as well. Once build successfully and all tests has past, the Merge option will be activated.
crypto_used_network_justification: We use ssh2 internal to the cluster and TLS1.2+ for the external interfaces.
crypto_verification_private_justificatio: We support TLS certification verification before exchange of private information.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: All packages are delivered either as an jar artifact or a docker image. Incase of maven artifacts, they can be removed using the pom file. In case of docker container. We can delete the container we dont want. Also control the orchestration in Kubernetes if you want to exclude certain docker images.
dco_justification: https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies describes requirements for acceptable contributions and is linked from the AAI project page. https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Java+code+style shows java code style. https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Developer+Best+Practices
governance_justification:
ONAP requires both a Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO), and a Contributor License Agreement (CLA).

https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Contribution+Agreements
code_of_conduct_justification: ONAP adheres to the Linux Foundation Code of Conduct, found at https://lfprojects.org/policies/code-of-conduct/
roles_responsibilities_justification:
The key roles in the project and their responsibilities are described at

https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Community+Offices+and+Governance

Current members are listed at

https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=8226539
access_continuity_justification: For AAI we have multiple committers and multiple contributes who are listed in https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Resources+and+Repositories#ResourcesandRepositories-ActiveandAvailableInventory All committers have access and rights to maintain the code base, approve and review incoming changes and release a new version of the artifact. This will let the project continue with minimal to no interruption if one person is incapacitated. Also this project is controlled by the linux foundation so we can add more committers if needed
bus_factor_justification: The project covered in this report have more than 2 persons who actively contribute and maintain code. https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Resources+and+Repositories#ResourcesandRepositories-ActiveandAvailableInventory
documentation_roadmap_justification: Road map for AAI can be found in https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/AAI+R3+Platform+Maturity?preview=%2F35523310%2F35523289%2FAAI+Roadmap+2018-01-05.pdf
documentation_architecture_justification: Architecture of AAI can be found in https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1015836
documentation_quick_start_justification: Information on setting up ONAP can be found at https://onap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guides/onap-developer/settingup/index.html
documentation_current_justification: Documentation is updated on a regular bases when needed.
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: No user interfaces; the project site is configurable for font size/colors.
internationalization_justification: It is not applicable at this point in time as the software will only be used by technical people and not by general public
maintenance_or_update_justification: All major releases are tagged in gerrit and the artifacts are stored with the release information on onap.nexus. So we can access all old versions of the artifact. If and when a upgrade requires certain steps to be followed they are being added to the release documents as needed
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: Vulnerabilities can be reported using the link https://wiki.onap.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=6591711 Currently we dont have any vulnerabilities reported, but the wiki page explains on how to report a vulnerability and how to report anonymously if you do not want the credit for it.
coding_standards_justification: Google coding style is used in ONAP https://github.com/google/styleguide
build_standard_variables_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_preserve_debug_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_non_recursive_justification: The application does not create native binaries.
build_repeatable_justification: All releases are tagged in gerrit(git), and the builds are controlled using jenkins. By providing the git tag information the same image can be build over and over again with same bit-for-bit result.
installation_standard_variables_justific: The compiled docker images and jar files can be installed/used as the user sees fit. Both run on JVM or docker.
installation_development_quick_justifica: All the components require only java and maven to begin with for a developer to quickly install and test it. Even for deployment using OOM and the right amount of resources, we can deploy the full AAI/ONAP suite in less than a day. The steps are documented in https://onap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/submodules/oom.git/docs/oom_quickstart_guide.html
external_dependencies_justification: External dependencies are controlled using the pom file, which can be found in the root folder for the projects
dependency_monitoring_justification: We use sonatype CLM https://nexus-iq.wl.linuxfoundation.org/ and https://sonar.onap.org
updateable_reused_components_justificati: External components are maintained through Maven. The user can get a list of all included components using the maven dependency tree and can update or reuse as they see fit
interfaces_current_justification: We choose free open source solutions in every case and choose up-to-date versions of the components.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: https://jenkins.onap.org - on every commit, a verification job runs which runs an automated test suite. The code check in cannot pass with out jenkins posting a +1 on the review.
regression_tests_added50_justification: We add tests in these cases.
test_statement_coverage80_justification: AAI is working toward additional coverage but lack of resources prevent us from acheiving it: https://sonar.onap.org
test_policy_mandated_justification: Contributing guide lines for development is recorded in https://wiki.onap.org/display/DW/Development+Procedures+and+Policies
implement_secure_design_justification: Gizmo strives to implement secure design principles. We encrypt data where possible, and run security scans on the code and its dependencies.
input_validation_justification: The project strives to validate all input
crypto_credential_agility_justification: Credentials are separate and can be replaced without code compilation.

name: Gardener
description: Gardener Kubernetes Engine offers a fast and production-ready deployment of certified Kubernetes clusters at all major cloud providers. Deliver any infrastructure reliably, consistently and cost-effectively. Gardener includes a dashboard, a command line client and an API.
contribution_justification: https://github.com/gardener/documentation/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
license_location_justification: https://github.com/gardener/gardener/blob/master/LICENSE.md
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://github.com/gardener/gardener/tree/master/docs
repo_public_justification: https://github.com/gardener
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. GitHub can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made. Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
tests_are_added_justification: Definition of done of issues usually requires:  "Unit tests are provided" and "Integration tests are provided"
warnings_justification: we run go fmt, go vet, golint, see https://github.com/gardener/gardener/blob/master/.ci/check
warnings_fixed_justification: we run golint and fail the build if it find issues
warnings_strict_justification: There is evidence that the Gardener project is striving to enable warning flags where it can, so that errors are detected early. Example: a shoot resource definition cannot be uploaded when it contains an error.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: Gardener invokes a multitude of other Open Source Software which is maintained in different projects, where the Gardener Team has no control about fixing vulnerabilities. But where this is possible the Gardener Team tries to reduce the number of public known vulnerabilities with medium to high severity to a minimum.
static_analysis_often_justification: Static source code analysis with Checkmarx occurs every week.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: the project does not produce software written in a memory-unsafe language (Go)
crypto_weaknesses_justification: We eliminated e.g. weak cyphers like 3DES https://github.com/gardener/gardener/pull/428
discussion_justification: https://github.com/gardener/documentation/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
hardening_justification: Gardener has introduced several network policies and did according community communication https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/gardener/Pom2Y70cDpw
crypto_used_network_justification: Standard Kubernetes means avoiding FTP, HTTP etc.
crypto_tls12_justification: Gardener supports at least TLS version 1.2
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
access_continuity_justification:
The Gardener project is quite large. https://github.com/orgs/gardener/people
There is no task which cannot be executed if any one person is incapacitated or killed
bus_factor_justification: The Gardener project is quite large. All teams have at least two maintainers https://github.com/orgs/gardener/teams.
documentation_security_justification:
1. https://gardener.cloud/tutorials/ search for security
2. As described in the Gardener Security Release Process: https://github.com/gardener/documentation/blob/master/security-release-process.md users can expect that the Gardener project team reduces the total time users are vulnerable to publicly known exploits as much as possible.
documentation_current_justification:
The Gardener project team members who are maintaining https://gardener.cloud and https://gardener.cloud/blog/ constantly keep the documentation consistent with the current version of the project results (including software produced by the project)
https://github.com/gardener/gardener/releases
https://github.com/gardener/dashboard/releases
https://github.com/gardener/gardenctl/releases
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: the software doesn't generate text intended for end-users
internationalization_justification: the software doesn't generate text intended for end-users
sites_password_security_justification: the project sites do not store passwords for this purpose
coding_standards_enforced_justification: Several Gardener repos automatically enforce its selected coding style(s) e.g. gardener uses golint https://github.com/gardener/gardener/blob/master/.ci/check
build_standard_variables_justification: Gardener uses Go build running in multi stage docker build, see: https://github.com/gardener/gardener/blob/master/Dockerfile
build_preserve_debug_justification: Gardener uses Go build running in multi stage docker build, see: https://github.com/gardener/gardener/blob/master/Dockerfile
build_non_recursive_justification: the Gardener components are built independent from each other into separate container images
build_repeatable_justification:
The Gardener project is not able to repeat the process of generating information from source files and get exactly the same bit-for-bit result.
But we are able to reproduce semantically equivalent results: We have dependencies in source tree, we do not modify our container images after release, we tag the source state with a GitHub release
external_dependencies_justification: can be found in each Gardener release (release asset called component_descriptor.yaml)  e.g. https://github.com/gardener/gardener/releases/download/0.17.4/component_descriptor.yaml
dependency_monitoring_justification: The Gardener project leverages Black Duck Binary Analysis fka Protecode to detect known vulnerabilities, and fix exploitable vulnerabilities or verify them as unexploitable
updateable_reused_components_justificati: Gardener provides a mechanism to auto update the Kubernetes version and the underlying host OS version
interfaces_current_justification: Gardener uses and offers maintained/patched Kubernetes and OS versions. The same is true for other leveraged OSS component versions.
automated_integration_testing_justificat: each merged PR (https://github.com/gardener/gardener/pulls) triggers a concourse build and deployment job (https://concourse.ci.gardener.cloud.sap/) which includes execution of and a report for the integration test suite
regression_tests_added50_justification: regression test are only added to an automated test suite when it is necessary or when the bugs are security related.
test_statement_coverage80_justification:
planned: with https://golang.org/cmd/cover/ we get already >50% statement coverage. Missing is:
1. continuous statement coverage automation 
2. >80% statement coverage
implement_secure_design_justification: The Gardener architecture itself https://github.com/gardener/documentation/wiki/Architecture is an implementation of secure design principles like introducing additional trust boundaries
input_validation_justification: The Gardener API uses Kubernetes API means with its declarative approach. Thus this criteria is irrelevant for the Gardener project.
signed_releases_justification: each container image contains cryptographically hashes, following the OCI spec https://github.com/opencontainers/image-spec#oci-image-format-specification
version_tags_signed_justification: via SAP's Repository Based Shipment Channel, SAP customers and partners can download cryptographically signed images of Gardener releases: https://shipments.pages.repositories.sap.ondemand.com/docs/shipment.html (restricted access). To provide cryptographically signed images of Gardener releases has not been a Gardener community requirement so far, besides the CII badge silver level compliance.
assurance_case_justification: General Kubernetes threats are published in the Kubernetes Threat Model: https://github.com/trailofbits/audit-kubernetes/tree/master/reports. To tackle these threats, Project Gardener follows the SAP Secure Software Development Life cycle: https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center/security.html#pdf-asset=a248a699-627c-0010-82c7-eda71af511fa&page=1 , published in the SAP Trust Center: https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center.html . However, this does not mean that Gardener managed Kubernetes clusters are secure by default. Gardener users must consider that Gardener managed Kubernetes clusters must be treated like root VMs. Thus, Gardener users are responsible to provide additional means to apply the appropriate security level which is required for the Gardener users’ dedicated scenario. To increase the security of container deployments, Gardener users can automatically apply secure defaults to their deployments with the Karydia security add-on: https://github.com/karydia/karydia . Gardener users can then decide which privileges are really needed and grant them accordingly.

name: StackStorm
description: StackStorm (aka "IFTTT for Ops") is event-driven automation for auto-remediation, security responses, troubleshooting, deployments, and more. Includes rules engine, workflow, 6000+ integrations (see https://exchange.stackstorm.org), ChatOps, etc. Installer at https://docs.stackstorm.com/install/index.html. Questions? https://forum.stackstorm.com/.
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://docs.stackstorm.com
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Standard Github practices: Tags for releases, master for the tip-of-the line, branches for PRs.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification:
Release notes is a section on documentation, and contains ChangeLog, Upgrade notes, and roadmap.
https://docs.stackstorm.com/changelog.html 
It is auto-generated from https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/blob/master/CHANGELOG.rst
release_notes_vulns_justification: There is no known vulnerabilities with CVE assignment just yet. We will identify them in CHANGELOG.rst once needed: the mechanics is already in place.
vulnerability_report_process_justificati:
StackStorm accepts vulnerability reports as Github issues: https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/issues
In addition, customers may use the process by ExtremeNetworks, our mothership company: https://gtacknowledge.extremenetworks.com/articles/Q_A/Where-can-I-find-information-about-security
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: Currently, no process for private reports is set up.
build_floss_tools_justification: Python, Tox, Nosetests for basic build and CI.
test_justification: Tox, Nosetests for basic build and CI.
test_policy_justification: New functionality can not reduce code coverage.
tests_documented_added_justification: This is covered in Development guidelines, https://docs.stackstorm.com/development/index.html
warnings_justification: Python linters used, and integrated to CI.
delivery_mitm_justification: https everywhere (can be turned off for development but strongly discouraged)
static_analysis_justification: pylint and pyflake as part of the build.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio:
The project is Github integrated tools - CircleCI, Travis, CodeCov, and other checks.
https://travis-ci.org/StackStorm/st2
https://circleci.com/gh/StackStorm/st2
discussion_justification:
GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
https://forum.stackstorm.com
https://stackstorm-community.slack.com
english_justification:
Documentation is sphinx-based, and hosted on https://docs.stackstorm.com. 
The issues are reported via Github, on https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/issues
hardened_site_justification: // One or more of the required security hardening headers is missing.
installation_common_justification:
The project relies on pre-built deb/rpm native OS packages to install/uninstall the software:
See https://github.com/stackstorm/st2-packages
dco_justification:
https://cla-assistant.io/ is used for CLA signing which is enforced by Github status checks.
Example signed agreement: https://cla-assistant.io/StackStorm/st2?pullRequest=4959
access_continuity_justification:
The project is part of the Linux Foundation.
Besides of that, project is maintained by the Technical Steering Committee which currently includes 10 members (https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/blob/master/OWNERS.md) that can maintain the project.
documentation_current_justification:
The project documentation is available at https://docs.stackstorm.com/ and automatically generated based on https://github.com/stackstorm/st2docs
Changelog: https://docs.stackstorm.com/changelog.html and Upgrade Notes: https://docs.stackstorm.com/upgrade_notes.html
sites_password_security_justification: The project is using Github which meets this criteria.
coding_standards_enforced_justification:
The coding style is automatically enforced by the pylint tool, checked for every PR.
https://github.com/StackStorm/lint-configs
build_standard_variables_justification: No native binaries are generated for Python project.
build_preserve_debug_justification: Not applicable for the Python project.
build_non_recursive_justification: Not applicable for the Python project.
build_repeatable_justification: Not applicable for the Python project.
installation_standard_variables_justific: The project builds deb/rpm native OS packages to install the software, the standards are enforced by those package managers and installers.
installation_development_quick_justifica:
Project provides a way to build from sources for development environment:
https://docs.stackstorm.com/development/sources.html
external_dependencies_justification: The project uses pip package manager format to manage external dependencies: https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/blob/master/requirements.txt
dependency_monitoring_justification:
Github periodic security checks external dependencies and warn the project in automated way.
https://help.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-security-alerts-for-vulnerable-dependencies
updateable_reused_components_justificati:
In the project it's easy to identify and update external components via pip package manager.
https://github.com/StackStorm/st2/blob/master/requirements.txt
interfaces_current_justification: Project relies on external FLOSS dependencies and packages.
automated_integration_testing_justificat:
Project enforces CI checks for master and every PR branch.
The tests could be reproduced by invoking the respective makefile targets and are reproducible.
regression_tests_added50_justification: Majority of the bugfixes are approved to be merged to the codebase when they have a set of corresponding tests.
test_statement_coverage80_justification:
The project code is covered by the tests for more than 80%
https://codecov.io/github/StackStorm/st2?branch=master
small_tasks_justification:
Issues for newcomers are tagged with the "good first issue":
https://github.com/stackstorm/st2/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22good+first+issue%22
two_person_review_justification:
All PRs are reviewed by the project Technical Steering Committee members. Review requirement is enforced by the Github project settings.
Examples of PRs: https://github.com/stackstorm/st2/pulls

name: Farbfeld Utilities
description: Used to manipulate pictures and to convert file formats.
sites_https_justification:
Not implemented. Even if it is implemented in future, it will never redirect the HTTP traffic to HTTPS, nor implement HSTS; it will be provided only as an option.
 // Given an http: URL.
contribution_justification: http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/farbfeld.ui/wiki?name=Frequently+Asked+Questions
license_location_justification: http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/farbfeld.ui/
floss_license_justification: Public domain
floss_license_osi_justification: It is public domain. Public domain is not a license, so OSI didn't approve it, but the program is FOSS.
documentation_basics_justification:
http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/farbfeld.ui/wiki?name=Documentation
http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/farbfeld.ui/home
repo_public_justification: Use http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/farbfeld.ui to download with Fossil, or http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/farbfeld.ui/dir?ci=tip for the webpage.
repo_track_justification: Use http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/farbfeld.ui to download with Fossil, or http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/farbfeld.ui/timeline for the webpage.
repo_distributed_justification: Fossil is used. (Do not know if it is considered to be common enough.)
version_semver_justification: Hash codes are used. It is trying to keep compatibility as much as possible anyways. The programs are independent, so even if one program is changed, there is no need to change the other programs.
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: Private reports are not implemented. All vulnerability reports MUST be public.
build_justification: Each file is an independent program. To compile, run it though the shell (bash).
build_floss_tools_justification: GCC is used (although it may also be compatible with Clang; untested).
test_invocation_justification: There is currently no test suite.
test_most_justification: There is currently no test suite.
warnings_justification: They warn about many things that are not applicable, so "-Wall" isn't used. The default warnings are used, though, which detect everything needed to detect.
warnings_fixed_justification: It compiles with no warnings. Warnings that are harmless are disabled for each individual file.
know_secure_design_justification: Much of this is not applicable to this project, but the stuff that is, is implemented ("least privilege", "least common mechanism" (no temporary files are used; it functions almost entirely with pipes), "limited attack surface" (there may be bugs; change this report if there are), "open design"; the rest are not applicable to this software).
know_common_errors_justification: It checks for buffer overflows and memory allocation errors. (If there is a bug, please report the bug and change this report.)
crypto_published_justification: Software does not deal with encryption.
crypto_random_justification: Some programs use random numbers, but they are not meant to be used in a context that must be secure; use different programs if you need that.
delivery_mitm_justification: HTTPS is not sufficient (but it does help).
general_comments: Is it possible to allow everyone to edit it? I want to enable editing for everyone.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: There is currently no test suite.
discussion_justification: http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/farbfeld.ui/ticket
hardened_site_justification:
HSTS will not be implemented.
// X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: Simply copy the files and compile. Delete them if you do not want them anymore.
dco_justification: Unfortunately it is not currently implemented, but it is also not currently needed.
bus_factor_justification: There is only one project member.
documentation_achievements_justification: No achievement will be posted; I do not wish to clutter it.
accessibility_best_practices_justificati: It deals with pictures. All other I/O is command-line interface.
internationalization_justification: Only error messages are displayed. Documentation could be localized, but not the program itself.
sites_password_security_justification: There are no remote accounts with passwords.
vulnerability_report_credit_justificatio: No vulnerabilities resolved in the last 12 months.
coding_standards_justification: There is no coding style requirement.
coding_standards_enforced_justification: There is no coding style requirement.
build_standard_variables_justification: This is not currently done, although it would be easy to implement if anyone needs it.
external_dependencies_justification: Most files have no external dependencies. A few do, and they are mentioned as part of the "gcc" command and #include commands, so the computer can process them.
updateable_reused_components_justificati: It includes a copy of LodePNG (although with modifications). LodePNG and other external libraries can be updated without causing a problem.
input_validation_justification: Most files are checked, but in some cases it is not necessary. Unicode is not used. Command-line parameters are assumed to be trusted, but files are untrusted.
small_tasks_justification: Please make a suggestion about how to do this if you have one.
require_2FA_justification:
All changes to the central repository and accessing sensitive data is done by the local user on the server computer, so authentication is not applicable.

(You should add "N/A" option to this requirement due to the case I mentioned.)
code_review_standards_justification: There are no code review requirements.
two_person_review_justification: Currently there is only the primary author, but if any external contributions are made, the project manager will review all of them.

name: FreeUHS
description: Free software for viewing and writing Universal Hint System files.
sites_https_justification: Although the repository is HTTP, the package (which also includes all source code) is HTTPS. // Given an http: URL.
contribution_requirements_justification: There are no required coding standards, but contributions are acceptable.
license_location_justification: http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/freeuhs.ui/artifact/75399a5be95bf881
floss_license_justification: Public domain
floss_license_osi_justification: Public domain is not a license, but it is FOSS.
documentation_basics_justification: https://www.npmjs.com/package/freeuhs
repo_public_justification: http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/freeuhs.ui/dir?ci=tip
repo_track_justification: http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/freeuhs.ui/timeline
repo_distributed_justification: Fossil is used.
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: Use the ticket system: http://zzo38computer.org/fossil/freeuhs.ui/tktnew All reports are public.
build_justification: It is written in an interpreted programming language (JavaScript).
build_floss_tools_justification: Node.js is used to execute the program; building is not needed.
crypto_published_justification: The catalog.js program can use HTTP or HTTPS or Gopher to download the catalog and hint files.
crypto_pfs_justification: When security is requested, HTTPS is used, which implements forward secrecy.
delivery_mitm_justification: If downloaded with npm, it will do this.
crypto_tls12_justification: The support is implemented as part of Node.js, not part of this software package.
hardened_site_justification:
HSTS will not be implemented.
// X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
installation_common_justification: You can use npm or just copy the files.
documentation_architecture_justification: The software is simple enough that we don't need it.
documentation_achievements_justification: I do not intend to add it.
accessibility_best_practices_justificati:
Non-text content isn't part of the program, but some UHS files might include them. Large print, braille, etc is a setting in the terminal emulator; FreeUHS does not itself need to worry about it.

The webpage is accessible in Lynx; it is tested. It works even without CSS and JavaScripts. The npm download is a command-line program does not need a webpage.
internationalization_justification: Currently it is only in English. Non-English versions may be written if wanted.
sites_password_security_justification: There are no remote users with passwords.
coding_standards_enforced_justification: No coding styles are required, so it can't be enforced.
build_standard_variables_justification: No native binaries are being generated; it is written in JavaScript.
build_preserve_debug_justification: There is no debugging information to preserve.
build_repeatable_justification: Written in an interpreted programming language.
installation_standard_variables_justific: The convention of npm is used, if you use npm to install it.
contributors_unassociated_justification: There is only one member, but he is unpaid.
copyright_per_file_justification: It mentions at the top of each file that each one is public domain. It isn't copyright.
small_tasks_justification: It doesn't, but suggestions are welcome how to do this.
require_2FA_justification: It is not applicable because the repository is only changed by the user local to the server that hosts the repository.
code_review_standards_justification: There aren't any code review requirements.
two_person_review_justification: Because there is only one main programmer, it is not applicable. Outside contributions will be reviewed if any (and then accepted, if it has been found to be acceptable), but currently there aren't any.

name: simgrid
description: Framework for the simulation of distributed applications (Clouds, HPC, Grids, IoT and others)
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/simgrid/simgrid/blob/master/COPYING>.
floss_license_justification: The LGPL-2.1 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: // Did not find license in the OSI list. The LGPL-2.1 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Some documentation basics file contents found.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: We commit every interim versions in the public git repository, a few hundred commits between each public releases.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: Non-trivial release notes file in repository: <https://github.com/simgrid/simgrid/blob/master/ChangeLog>.
release_notes_vulns_justification: We have release notes, and we specify the fixed bugs. If there were any CVE, we would deal the same way with them.
test_justification: We use ctest extensively, and developed our tooling toward integrating testing.
tests_are_added_justification: We have a coverage of 80% overall, and of 82% on new code.
warnings_justification: We add a large amount of warning flags, along with -Werror to ensure that they are not ignored. We also use SonarQube to automate code review.
warnings_fixed_justification: The -Werror flag is used to ensure this.
warnings_strict_justification: We use a large amount of warnings. All the ones that we could think of.
know_common_errors_justification: In addition, SonarQube help us detecting such issues.
delivery_unsigned_justification: We don't provide sha1sum (but https downloads) so the hash that don't exist don't transit over http.
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: The many assertions of the project cannot be disabled easily.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests, and we have a mailing list + an IRC channel.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
bus_factor_justification: truck-factor reports our project to have a bus factor of 2.
documentation_achievements_justification: The badge is in the main README.md https://github.com/simgrid/simgrid
internationalization_justification: It's a scientific library. English is the international scientific language.
sites_password_security_justification: We do not store any password.
vulnerability_response_process_justifica: They are handled as regular bugs, because SimGrid code is not intended to run elsewhere that on the author machine.
build_standard_variables_justification: SimGrid is part of Debian, with no major patch, and this is a requirement there too.
build_preserve_debug_justification: That's also a requirement of Debian.
build_non_recursive_justification: We don't have any library embeeded.
build_repeatable_justification: This is ensured in Debian, only the doxygen documentation fails on that criteria.
installation_standard_variables_justific: This is also are requirement of Debian.
dependency_monitoring_justification: We leverage the Debian infrastructure on this one too.
updateable_reused_components_justificati: We only use standard components of our dependencies.
interfaces_current_justification: We use paranoid compilation flags in that area too.
test_policy_mandated_justification:
If it's not in the tests, it's not in the library and can gets removed.
http://simgrid.gforge.inria.fr/simgrid/latest/doc/inside_tests.html
implement_secure_design_justification: We use many static analyzer to ensure that our code is clean.
copyright_per_file_justification: Each source file contains this info
